name: Azure App Service Web app doesn't use latest PHP version
description: This policy identifies App Service Web apps that are not configured with latest PHP version. Periodically, newer versions are released for PHP software either due to security flaws or to include additional functionality. It is recommended to use the latest PHP version for web apps in order to take advantage of security fixes, if any.
searchModel.query: config from cloud.resource where cloud.type = 'azure' AND api.name = 'azure-app-service' AND json.rule = 'config.isPhpVersionLatest exists and config.isPhpVersionLatest equals false'
recommendation:
1. Log in to the Azure Portal
2. Navigate to 'App Services' dashboard
3. Select the reported web app service
4. Under 'Settings' section, Click on 'Configuration'
5. Click on 'General settings' tab, Ensure that Stack is set to PHP and Minor version is set to latest version.
6. Click on 'Save'
compliance.standard: Australian Cyber Security Centre (ACSC) Essential Eight
CyberSecurity Law of the People's Republic of China
New Zealand Information Security Manual (NZISM v3.4)
